Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a thing that blocks one's way 障碍物
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Her father's opposition remained their only obstacle.

Vocabularies.Definition: so as to be safe if (sth.) happens  万一；假使
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Take a hat with you in case the sun is very hot.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  helpful; showing approval 有利的；赞同的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  This region has a favourable climate for growing apples.

Vocabularies.Definition: offer; last; stand fast 提出，提供；维持；坚持
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The forthcoming talks hold out the hope of real arms reductions.

Vocabularies.Definition: because of 由于
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was late due to the very heavy traffic.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   decide that (sth. arranged in advance) will not happen 取消
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The match had to be cancelled because of bad weather.

Vocabularies.Definition: cancel 取消
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They have called off their trip to Tibet.

Vocabularies.Definition: immediately before 在…前夕
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We are going to have a family reunion on the eve of the New Year.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   not present; missing 缺席的；没有的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was absent from the meeting.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  (of a wind, etc.) blowing strongly; not easily bent, changed in shape, etc.（风等）强烈的；硬的；僵直的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He walk forward difficultly because of the stiff wind.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.	 a thing that makes a situation more complex or difficult 复杂情况；（新出现的）困难；障碍
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Another complication was the excess of imports over exports.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.   endure without giving in; resist 承受；抵挡
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  This building is able to withstand destruction forces of nature.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  worry; be relevant to; affect 使担心；涉及；影响 concerned  a. worried; troubled 担心的；忧虑的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We're rather concerned about father's health.

Vocabularies.Definition: before 在…之前
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We received no notification prior to today's date.

Vocabularies.Definition: prevent from moving  把…困住; 使不能行动
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He was pinned down by his attackers.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a thing aimed at or wished for 目标
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  My objective this summer will be learning to swim.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  being the cause of; legally or morally obliged; reliable and sensible 作为原由的； 应承担责任的；负责可靠的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The bus driver is responsible for the passengers safety.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. fight for; struggle to win or keep 争夺 n.  争夺；竞争；比赛
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  How many people are contesting the seat on the council?

Vocabularies.Definition: bring good results; succeed 取得好结果；成功
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His hard work paid off when he got a promotion.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. talk about in a manner showing too much pride and satisfaction 吹嘘
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The boy boasted that his bicycle was of the best quality of all the bicycles in the school.
